CatDescriptText: Mrs. Ruth Turner, housewife, 553 Aiken Street was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 28, 1959, pg. 1 with question: "Do you think that education standards should be the same throughout the city school system or should they be lowered in order to accommodate the slower-learning pupils, particularly those who suffer the handicaps of poor home or neighborhood environments?" answer reads: "No, I think that there should be special classes like we already have in our schools. The so-called average child should not be slowed down in his learning by the slow learner, because it just isn't fair.  I think that you always are going to have the educational standards varying with the different areas.  But I do believe that the amount spent per pupil should be the same regardless of the area."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of smiling Ruth Turner wearing light colored coat and floral head scarf, standing on sidewalk in front of stores
